danaus

Class Aroma

  • java.lang.Object
    • danaus.Aroma
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Aroma>

    public class Aroma
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Aroma>
    An instance represents an aroma. Aromas have both an intensity and an associated flower that produced them. In order for a flower to appear in a tile's list of aromas, it must be stronger than the the minimum aroma intensity.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double intensity
      The intensity of a flower.
      static double MIN_AROMA_INTENSITY
      The smallest an aroma can be to appear in a tile's list of aromas.

    • Field Detail

      • MIN_AROMA_INTENSITY

        public static final double MIN_AROMA_INTENSITY
        The smallest an aroma can be to appear in a tile's list of aromas.

      • intensity

        public double intensity
        The intensity of a flower. Intensity is on a linear scale. That is, an intensity 2t is twice as intense as an intensity t.

    • Method Detail

        Returns the flowerId of the flower that produced the aroma.

        s - The number of steps away from the initial intensity.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Aroma obj)
        Return a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer depending on whether this object is less than, equal to, or greater than obj. Comparison is first made based on their flowers, then on their intensities.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Aroma>
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than obj.
